definition: to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)

sentences.english: Encourage South Korea ball exercises, collision Chinese fishing boats.
sentences.chinese: 鼓勵南韓實彈演習，衝撞中國漁船。

sentences.english: But the current spat has become much more hostile, with both sides announcing live-fire naval drills were recently held.
sentences.chinese: 但目前爭論日趨尖銳，雙方近期都宣佈進行實彈演習。

sentences.english: PLA Navy to conduct live-ammunition drill in Yellow Sea.
sentences.chinese: 中國人民解放軍海軍在黃海進行實彈演習。

sentences.english: South Korea has planned a live-fire drill this weekend.
sentences.chinese: 韓國計劃週末進行實彈演習。

sentences.english: The security forces responded by firing live ammunition.
sentences.chinese: 安全部隊實彈射擊予以迴應。

sentences.english: The intensity of the live fire and bombing drills will now be stepped up, though.
sentences.chinese: 然而，現在要加強實彈射擊和轟炸訓練的強度。

sentences.english: When that didn't work, he used tear gas and live ammunition.
sentences.chinese: 不起作用時，他使用催淚瓦斯和實彈抵抗反動民衆。

sentences.english: China's Navy has begun conducting its annual live ammunition exercises drill in the East China Sea.
sentences.chinese: 中國海軍在東海海域已開始進行例行性實彈演習。

sentences.english: It is hardly surprising that an experience as stressful as armed combat can disrupt the normal functioning of the brain.
sentences.chinese: 荷槍實彈戰鬥的緊張壓力通常會損壞大腦的正常功能。
三叉路口被公然用作“實彈射擊區”。

sentences.english: Navy conducts live-ammunition training in South China Sea.
sentences.chinese: 中國海軍在南海進行實彈演習。

sentences.english: South Korea was holding live-fire drills yesterday but said it was not firing towards the North.
sentences.chinese: 韓國昨日舉行實彈演練，但稱並非針對朝鮮。

sentences.english: Can you imagine Argentina to make live-fire drill near Forkland Island?
sentences.chinese: 你能想象阿根廷在馬島附近實彈演習？

sentences.english: The injured suffered gunshot wounds but the army denied using live rounds.
sentences.chinese: 受傷者傷口源於槍擊，但軍方拒絕承認使用了實彈。

sentences.english: At least one soldier appeared to fire live ammunition into the crowd, some eyewitnesses said.
sentences.chinese: 一些目擊者稱，至少有一名士兵看來向人羣實彈射擊。

sentences.english: The police fired hundreds of volleys of stun grenades and tear gas to try and clear the area in front of parliament.
sentences.chinese: 警方施放實彈和催淚彈試圖清理議會前的區域。

definition: North and South Korea/bilateral Korean relations
military aircraft/secret plan/Privy Council during the Qing dynasty
